title: David and Victoria Beckham lead stars sharing childhood pics for Kate Middleton campaign
body_text:
David and Victoria Beckham lead stars sharing childhood pics for Kate Middleton campaign
David Beckham and Victoria Beckham have joined many other celebs in supporting a new campaign led by Kate Middleton, to raise awareness of the vital role our early years play
David Beckham and Victoria Beckham have taken a trip down memory lane by sharing childhood photographs to help back a royal early-years campaign.
It's part of the Shaping Us campaign led by Kate Middleton, the Princess of Wales, to raise awareness of the vital role our early years play in shaping the rest of our lives.
Kate sent a call out for people to talk about their early childhoods and “how they’ve shaped your lives”.
Those joining in with the campaign were also told they could share a photograph that may 'help with those conversations and to share some smiles and memories too'.
In his post, David, 47, can be seen donning a Manchester United kit from head to toe as he kicks a football around his back garden.
Meanwhile, a three year old Victoria, 48, can be wearing a light blue poncho. The fashion designer captioned her post and explained its relevance to the campaign.
She said: "I was 3 years old in this picture and already experimenting with fashion!!
"Our early childhood years are so important to shaping the rest of our lives, which is why I'm supporting @princeandprincessofwales in raising awareness for #ShapingUs and @earlychildhood."
David isn't the only England captain to get involved, with both Harry Kane and Leah Williamson joining the campaign.
Tottenham star Harry, 29, who is sporting a striking pair of black and white striped shorts in his picture, wrote: “I’m only 5 in this pic, but look at the right foot ready to go!
“Our early childhood shapes the rest of our lives. From pregnancy to the age of five, the world around us, the people we meet, and the experiences we have are all #ShapingUs.”
England women’s captain Leah, who led the Lionesses to glory at last summer’s European Championships, is just three and dressed in a fairy costume, complete with a shiny star, in the photograph she shared.
Williamson, 25, wrote: “3 years old. Starting to believe in [dizzy emoji]”
Broadcaster Fearne Cotton, 41, has also got involved by sharing an image of her at about four, wearing denim dungarees and winking at the camera.
She adds: “Possibly the age I started to cultivate my own style and love of clothes and definitely the age I started to get super passionate about art and creativity.”
Apart from his musical talents, rapper Professor Green, 39, is also known for his campaigning on mental health and his openness about his own personal struggles.
The Read All About It hitmaker, originally from Hackney, east London, chose an image of himself as a toddler riding a bicycle.
He wrote: “PG at 3 years old. Little did I know the mischief I’d later get up to while ‘peddlin’ ‘ [winking emoji]
“Given the start I had in life anyone on the outside could have probably seen me coming a mile off – the unexpected bit was making good.
“Our early childhood shapes the rest of our lives (all the work I’ve done and I’m still unlocking parts of mine till this day!)”
Chef Jamie Oliver, 47, who has become a household favourite after a series of TV shows and a campaign to improve school dinners, is beaming in his childhood photograph.
He wrote: “I was 5 years old here. Check out how happy I look in my brown cords, trackie top and strap-on roller skates! I feel so lucky I had a great childhood, growing up in my mum and dad’s pub.
“Not only did it give me a thirst for food knowledge, and a passion for pursuing that as a career, it taught me about people and community.”
Former Saturdays singer Rochelle Humes is four in her photograph and smiling straight at the camera in a denim outfit.
She joked: “I hear double denim is back..ahead of the curve…” and added “our early childhood shapes the rest of our lives.”
